title: Shah Rukh, Kajol recreate iconic poster of DDLJ
text:
Shah Rukh, Kajol recreate iconic poster of DDLJ Hyderabad, Oct 20, 2015, (PTI) Two decades after the release of "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge", actor Shah Rukh Khan recreated the iconic scene of lifting up co-star Kajol on his shoulder. 

The 49-year-old actor and Kajol, 41, who are teaming up again for Rohit Shetty's "Dilwale", marked the 20 years celebration by revisiting DDLJ's famous poster while shooting for the upcoming movie here.

"Want to thank Team Rohit Shetty Red Chillies for doing this last minute. All looked happy that I picked Kajol again," he posted on Twitter.

Shah Rukh also informed his fans that Rohit, who used the popular train scene in his 2013 hit "Chennai Express", has made a special video for DDLJ.

"Celebrated enough tonite with Dilwale team. But amidst mad shooting Rohit has a made a video for you all for DDLJ. YRF will upload it soon (sic)," he added.

Directed by Aditya Chopra, the romance drama also starred Mandira Bedi, Anupam Kher, Amrish Puri and Farida Jalal. The film, which completed 1,000 weeks on December 12 last year, is still running at a Mumbai theatre.
